page.title: 05Ravensworth Castle
page.content: The ruins of the castle stand at the south end of the village, very near to the school. It is built on a small mound surrounded by a marsh, which was originally a lake. The remains consist of one tower and a{14th cent.}gateway and a few other fragments of building. It was demolished in the late{16th / early{17th cent.}and has looked as it does today since the late{18th {century.} The local villagers used the stones for building. The{Fitzhugh}family owned it until the{16th cent.}One of the family,{Akar,}founded{Jervaulx {Abbey}.In{1512}the family line came to an end and a cousin,{Lord Parr of {Kendal}inherited it. In{1571}it passed to the{Crown.}After that it had numerous owners, until recently the {Craddocks,}the{ Jaffreys} and now {Mr. Forest}of{Whorlton Hall.
